page.title: 15 The New A45 Bypass at Wilby
page.content: The villagers of Wilby hoped that the opening of the new road would reduce the noise & fumes that have made life miserable for those who lived along the main road.However heavy lorries going to & from the Enterprise Zone were still thundering through the village especially in early morning & early evening.Many drivers found it quicker to use the old route rather than the bypass.The residents complained to the local council that the noise was continuing & a petition was signed by 80% of the villagers calling for a lorry ban.It was then decided to impose a weight restriction of 7.5 tonnes on lorries passing through the village in the hope that this will make the village a quieter & less dangerous place in which to live.
